module.name: packaged_part_black_box_model
module.name.french: Modèle de boîte noire de composants encapsulés
module.keywords: module, black box, behaviour, model, analysis, design, electrical, electronic, mechanical, piece part, component

abstract.li: the simulation model for a part;
the container or package for a part.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information necessary to describe a product as a part for the next level of assembly. The inner structure of this part isn't visible by the electronic assembly designer. This module defines the information necessary to describe the product terminals that are directly connected for the purposes of normal usage.

inscope.li: items within the scope of application module Functional assignment to part, ISO/TS 10303-1674;
items within the scope of application module Functional usage view, ISO/TS 10303-1705;
items within the scope of application module Package, ISO/TS 10303-1707;
items within the scope of application module Part external reference, ISO/TS 10303-1711.

aa.refpath_extend: characterized_definition characterized_definition = product_definition product_definition product_definition => physical_unit => packaged_part

packaged_part <= physical_unit <= product_definition <- product_definition_relationship.related_product_definition {product_definition_relationship product_definition_relationship.name = 'used package'} product_definition_relationship product_definition_relationship.relating_product_definition -> product_definition => physical_unit => package

packaged_part <= physical_unit <= product_definition_shape <= property_definition <- property_definition_representation.definition {property_definition_representation.name = 'used package'} property_definition_representation.used_representation -> representation {representation representation.name = 'package external reference'}

packaged_part_terminal <= shape_aspect shape_aspect.of_shape -> product_definition_shape => physical_unit => packaged_part
